clinical_study.brief_title: Time Restricted Feeding on Weight Loss and Cardio-protection (TREATY Trial)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Time-Restricted Feeding on Weight Loss and Cardiometabolic Risk Factors in Obese Adults: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Time restricted feeding (TRF) is a novel type of intermittent calorie restriction diet that involves eating a daily period of 8 hours or less. This is a randomized controlled trial to evaluate the effect of time restricted feeding (TRF) on weight loss and cardiometabolic risk factors in obese adults over 12 months compared to continuous energy restriction (CER).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in body weight over 6 months and 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)
Quality of sleep measured by the Pittsburgh sleep quality index (PSQI)
Quality of life measured by the 12-item Short-Form Health Survey Questionnaire (SF-12)

intervention.description: Participants will receive a diet of 1500-1800kcal/d for men and 1200-1500kcal/d for women during a window of 8 h/d (8 am to 4 pm).
Participants will follow receive a diet of 1500-1800kcal/d for men and 1200-1500kcal/d for women, without a restriction of feeding time.
